{"step_by_step_thinking": "The SSI (Surgical Site Infection) rate in patients with a clean contaminated wound refers to the percentage of patients who develop an infection at the surgical site. A clean contaminated wound is a surgical incision made under controlled conditions, but with a higher risk of infection due to the presence of potentially infective materials. According to the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention), the SSI rate in patients with a clean contaminated wound is generally expected to be around 1-2%. Therefore, the answer choice is A. 1-2%.", "answer_choice": "A"}
